newsitem.title: USA: Wisconsin nuke seen in restart by Weds.
newsitem.headline: Wisconsin nuke seen in restart by Weds.

text.p: Wisconsin Electric Power Co said Monday its 485 megawatt Point Beach nuclear power unit 1 will resume electricity production by early Wednesday following an unexpected shutdown for repairs.
"We plan to return unit 1 to service either late Tuesday or early Wednesday," company spokeswoman Jackie Olson said.
Point Beach 1, located in Two Rivers, Wis., was shut Tuesday to repair a support cooling system pump.
The adjoining Point Beach nuclear unit 2 remained in a maintenance and refueling outage which began in October, 1996.
Restart of the 485 megawatt unit 2 has been delayed to early April while Wisconsin Electric addresses startup issues with the Nuclear Regulatory Commission.
Wisconsin Electric is a subsidiary of Wisconsin Energy Corp.
